description: Fifteen children are among the dead after the flooding of the Guadalupe River struck a popular tourist region. Dozens more girls attending a summer camp are reported missing.

The arms dealer, the general's daughter and the speed demon: An inheritance battle
description: Akram Ojjeh built his fortune as a middleman for French arms sales to Saudi Arabia, up until his death in 1991. The legal battle that his third wife, the Syrian Nahed Tlass-Ojjeh, and his youngest son, a luxury car collector, have waged against the rest of the family could have been just a run-of-the-mill inheritance dispute. But its ramifications extend to matters of state.

headline: 'Simple Buddhist monk' Dalai Lama celebrates landmark 90th birthday
description: The Dalai Lama turned 90 on Sunday surrounded by thousands of followers, who thronged the Himalayan town of Dharamshala, where the spiritual leader of Tibetan Buddhism has been living in exile since fleeing Chinese rule in Tibet in 1959.

headline: Grand scale design in Corsica
description: A forgotten chair on the sand. A lamppost rising among the trees. A vase perched on a rock. A blanket flapping in the wind. Amid the island's wild landscapes, photographer Alexandre Guirkinger has staged some spectacular pieces with the help of set designer Vincent Olivieri.

headline: In the jaws of the Jackal: How an informant orchestrated a policewoman's fall
description: Sonia C. was still a law enforcement officer when, in April 2024, she was sentenced to three years in prison for handing police files to an informant known as the Jackal. Naivety still marks this former officer, who loved to party until dawn and used cocaine.

description: In November 2022, after being detained by police near Melitopol, Hanna Peklo was raped by a Russian soldier. The Ukrainian war crimes department has identified her rapist.

headline: Tehran: A map of military bases and strategic sites struck by Israel
description: For 12 days, starting on June 13, the Iranian capital was attacked with a wave of air strikes conducted by the Israeli army. As well as military targets, several residential buildings belonging to key regime figures and scientists were struck.
byline: Flavie Holzinger,  Riccardo Pravettoni and  Victor Simonnet

headline: 'Anger has become, from Trump to Le Pen, a powerful weapon for the far right'
description: Emotions like anger can numb critical thinking, make people forget facts, and even lead them to vote against their own interests, writes Le Monde's Philippe Bernard in his column.
